sections.heading: Corn Colors
sections.text: Use yellows and golden yellows for the corn kernels. Greens work well for the husks and stalks. Add browns for the cob.

tips.techniques: A. Textured Effects: With a sharp pencil, create tiny dots in varied yellow shades on the kernels. This mimics the bumpy, seeded texture. B. Illustrating Specific Elements: Use bright yellow for the plump kernel rows. Color the stringy insides a paler yellow, and the outer husks green.
tips.challenge: Color corn stalks, husks, and kernels using colors of the rainbow – red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple. It helps practice seamless color transitions across organic shapes.
